p: Due to the higher plasticity, B. frondosa had more massive biomass after six weeks of growth and a greater final height than native B. bipinnata. Thus, the higher plasticity of B. frondosa regarding biomass and height likely confers a competitive advantage over native B. bipinnata (van Kleunen et al., 2015). Notably, differences in the biomass and final stature were more manifest when plants were grown without competition, indicating that the role of plasticity of B. frondosa would be of importance in disturbed habitats without other competing species.
